title: John and Betty's Scotch history visit,
author: Williamson, Margaret. [from old catalog]
snippet: ^^ I shouldn't wonder if the King's Knot faded away altogether before that flying machine  comes," said Betty dreamily.

title: John and Betty's Scotch history visit,
author: Williamson, Margaret. [from old catalog]
snippet: Just below the great castle rock, which is clearly seen from that point, is the ancient King's Park and the King's Knot, the quaint shapes of the latter 's flower-beds now like faint ghosts of the old royal garden.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: In the centre of this horticultural relic is an octagonal mound called the King's Knot, where it is said the monarch and his courtiers engaged in the favourite amusement of the Round Table.

title: Travels in Scotland: translated from the German. With notes by the translator [John Kesson]
author: Kohl, Johann Georg.
snippet: The mound in the centre is called the " King's Knot,"from which different walks diverge.
